result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Anthony Pufahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of GUILTY PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING commencing 01/22/16, received and filed. (24 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION.

BRANCH 28 HELD IN BRANCH 26.  Defendant Michael Anthony Pufahl in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Defendant Michael Anthony Pufahl in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski for Daniel Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3 years, concurrent to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Comply with the conditions of extended supervision in armed robbery, Waukesha County case 15CF1340.
*No driving without a valid driver's license.


- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, income and assets, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Appeal rights given. 
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Attorney Gregory Allan Renden in court, defendant Michael Anthony Pufahl not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in custody in Waukesha.  Matter adjourned for plea/sentencing.

Parties are informed that effective December 14, 2015, this matter will be assigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders, Room 629 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Anthony Pufahl in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Defense to make a referral to Drug Treatment Court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Anthony Pufahl in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference conducted.  Parties may have reached a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 07-30-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Anthony Pufahl in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty as to Count 2.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.

Court orally amended the Criminal Complaint to read the address of offense as 5301 S. 76th St., in the Village of Greendale, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin.
Oral, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart.

Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
